intro: Wahlenbergia tsaratananae, commonly known as the Tsaratanana bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
